column1: So if you could please tell us what did you think about the use of VR in these stories in both the context that you watched and what parts of these stories stood out to you? What parts of these stories what? Stood out to you. Oh I mean I think, I mean I gotta be honest I think it seems like one of those things that seems really cool in theory but sucks in reality. Like I don't think, I don't think a classroom full of kids is gonna sit with a bunch of stuff on their face.

explore anything. I think it's, it ain't gonna do nothing. Like, I don't buy it. Like, just even, even the little thing, I mean, everyone's gonna be trying to shoot the thing and mess with it and constantly, like, I just don't see that working at all. And doing it all at home, like, that's your actual school. I think that would be just, you know, I just don't think, again, I just don't think it would work. I don't, I mean, if you're living in a rural area by yourself, and there's literally no other kids around, maybe.

But I just have a hard time seeing how it would kind of bridge the gap between, in theory, what it would be and in the reality of having everything on your face and in your hands correctly and having the internet working correctly so that works and then having it be actually engaging enough. I think that's kind of one of the big things. Even when we were doing the little exploration thing, it's like...

Yeah, it's kind of cool, but we spend half the time trying to figure out how to move the rooms, and then you kind of go through the rooms and it's, you can't move or anything, you're just sitting there watching essentially a video playing of some guy floating around. I mean, it's cool in a way, but I don't want to spend another hour sitting there watching that, you know? So, as much as I think it's kind of cool, I just, I just don't think it would work in school. The only thing even with the family part that I thought would be kind of fun would be like,
People live in other areas. We've got family across the country that, in theory, we would do that. And I think it would be fun. But in reality?

I don't think everyone's actually gonna wanna sit down and put stuff on their face and click around. Can you tell me more about this? Cause you've kept mentioning it, in reality wouldn't work. Are they gonna wanna play Monopoly?

I just, again, I think it's...

going to be that much more. You mean like physical board games or you mean video games? Physical board games. people that have the newest and greatest technology all the time.
